history.content:
See Lily's answer at the bottom of @1860

Basically, it's policy that whether you get in the class depends on whether you get off the discussion waitlist, not the lecture waitlist. It has always been this way, even in Telebears.

What you're proposing is a policy change; best of luck trying to make that happen.

children.subject: that looks to me exactly what he is complaining about
Anon's suggestion of "go through the wait lists manually and put everyone in by order on the wait list" sounds like they are not familiar with how waitlists are processed.

I'll note that if instructors really are fine with allowing students to attend any section, and if they're not worried about some sections being overfull while others being empty, they can (at least, in the old system) have the class set up to not require students to enroll for section. This is what 170 did last semester.

There's unfortunate side effects, like the increased perception that section is optional, or the aforementioned imbalance in attendance (which is often traditionally resolved by saying that students officially enrolled in that section have priority). But this is an option the instructors have, if they feel the advantages outweigh these issues.

To clarify: getting into the class requires getting into both lecture and discussion, which requires open seats in both. In general, this means that as long as there are open seats in the discussion, you can get in. But, we can see examples even today of classes with open seats in discussion but people waitlisted, because they don't have seats reserved for them in lecture. (And even without reserved seats, it is possible for lecture to be full but discussions to not be.)

What has changed is the inability to switch the section that you are waitlisted for. This is certainly an unfortunate change, and hopefully can be fixed. This does not seem to be the primary part of what the post is complaining about though.
What if you're on the wait list for lecture but you are enrolled in a section?
Even if SIS fixed the system now to allow disc changes they can't implement it. The advisors have already recommended many people to drop because the system doesn't work. Wouldn't be fair.

history.content:
I'm just really angry that classes I thought I would for sure get are now a gamble because my section might be full. I'll 100% not be able to get in my classes if I drop my position on the wait list

Is there really no way for someone to just go through the wait lists manually and put everyone in by order on the wait list? It's ridiculous that the only answer on here is "yeah you're #20 on the wait list but you should drop the class and get behind 200 other people"
history.subject: Why is SIS so bad
